description: From Middle English quethen, cwethen, from Old English cweþan, from Proto-Germanic *kweþaną, from Proto-Indo-European *gʷet- (“to say, speak”).

verbs.description: quethe (third-person singular simple present quethes, present participle quething, simple past quoth or quod or quethed, past participle quoth or quethen or quethed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete except in past tense quoth) To say or declare.
